text.__SUMMARY__:
Fritillaria crassifolia is a Middle Eastern species of bulb-forming plants in the lily family, native to Iran, Iraq, Turkey, Syria, and Lebanon.
SubspeciesFritillaria crassifolia subsp. crassifolia - Iran, Turkey, Syria, and Lebanon
Fritillaria crassifolia subsp. hakkarensis Rix - Iraq, Turkey
Fritillaria crassifolia subsp. poluninii Rix - Iraqformerly includedFritillaria crassifolia subsp. kurdica (Boiss. & Noë) Rix, now called Fritillaria kurdica
